h2-start-looking: When can I start looking for a job?

p-start-looking.p1-2: before you can begin applying for jobs.
p-start-looking.p2: You cannot apply for jobs or work while The Norwegian Directorate of Immigration (UDI) processes your application.

h2-find-job: Where can I find a job?

p-find-job.p1: You can look for a job at arbeidsplassen.no, one of the largest databases for job advertisements in Norway. Here you can also find
p-find-job.p2-2: at arbeidsplassen.no you can follow a live broadcast where companies present themselves and the positions you can apply for.  Jobbtreff is mainly held in Norwegian. Take a look at
p-find-job.p2-3: if you can find one in English.

h2-assistance: Who can I contact for assistance and guidance?

p-assistance.p1: If you need assistance finding a job, you can
p-assistance.p1-2: for information and guidance.  If you are registered as a job seeker at NAV, NAV can help you to get in touch with relevant employers and provide you with various measures in order to get a job. You can
p-assistance.p1-link-text-2: register as a job seeker at nav.no (Norwegian language).
p-assistance.p1-3: If you need assistance you can contact your local NAV office.
p-assistance.p1-link-text-3: Video - Register as a job seeker
p-assistance.p2: You have the right to get an interpreter when contacting NAV.
p-assistance.p3: If you have questions, please call NAV at 55 55 33 33

h2-working-wo-norwegian: Where can I work without Norwegian language skills?

p-working.p1-2: or where english is specified as working language.

p-no-courses.p1: Persons with granted collective protection may be entitled to free Norwegian courses. Further
p-no-courses.p1-2: and your rights to attend free Norwegian courses are to be found at the official website of IMDi.
p-no-courses.p2: There are also possibilities to learn Norwegian language skills while working through the flexible fast track.
